translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses of the Therīs🔽The Chapter with Sumedhā at the Head
The Elder Nun Kaṭacchubhikkhā Dāyikā’s Verses
“As I was wandering for alms,
of the Teacher named Tissa;
I offered a handful of grass,
to the best of Buddhas.
The Buddha, the Fully Awakened One,🔽Tissa, the Leader of the World,
the Teacher, standing in the street,
gave me his blessing.
‘Having given a handful of grass,
you will go to the Tāvatiṃsa Heaven;
among the thirty-six gods,
you will be the Great Benefactor.
Among the fifty kings,
you will be the Great Benefactor.
Whatever you wish for in your mind,
you will receive at all times.
Having experienced perfection,
you will go forth, having nothing;
having fully understood all the pollutants,
you will be extinguished, without pollutants.’
Having said this, the Buddha,
Tissa, the Leader of the World,
the Hero, rose up into the sky,

analyzed: ambare  su dinnam me dānavara  suyiṭṭhāḥ yāga sampadā
translated: like a king of swans in the sky.🔽My gift was well given,🔽my sacrifice was well performed;
having given a handful of grass,
I have attained the unshakable state.
Twenty-two eons ago,
the gift I gave then
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving almsfood.
My defilements are destroyed,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me
I have fulfilled the Buddha’s instructions.
The four analytical insights,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ kaṭacchubhikkhādāyikā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam kaṭacchubhikkhādāyikā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have fulfilled the Buddha’s instructions.”🔽Thus spoke the nun Kaṭacchubhikkhādāyikā, and with that she passed away.
The Story of the Elder Nun Kaṭacchubhikkhādāyikā is the seventh.
